benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/payments - Trigger a payment using the account external key

covered: POST: Valid Payload scenarios (e.g., TC01, TC02, TC03) - successful 201 responses with Location header
POST: Invalid Payload handling (malformed body, invalid fields) - TC09, TC11, TC18
POST: Input validation coverage - missing externalKey (TC08), missing header (TC10), invalid paymentMethodId (TC11)
POST: Server error handling / gateway failures - gateway submission failure (TC14), dependency down (TC24), timeouts (TC16), unknown status (TC15), unauthorized (TC17)
POST: Security / malformed input checks - malicious payload (TC18)
POST: Edge cases - minimal values (TC22) and partial input (TC23)
POST: Realistic account scenarios - default/non-default payment methods (TC01, TC06) and no default with paymentMethodId (TC06)
POST: Specific error paths for missing/unknown accounts or methods - account not found (TC07, TC20) and invalid paymentMethodId (TC11)
POST: Regression tests - pluginProperty handling (TC25) and backward compatibility (TC26)
POST: Performance tests - normal/peak/load (TC27, TC28, TC29)
gaps: Duplicate submission handling (idempotency / repeated POST) is not covered (no test ensuring graceful handling of duplicates or idempotent behavior).
500 Internal Server Error scenario (e.g., DB failure) not explicitly tested for a true 500 response.
Rate limiting / throttling tests for bursty traffic are absent.
403 Forbidden scenarios (beyond 401 Unauthorized) are not explicitly tested.
Caching behavior coverage is not applicable to POST in this suite; no GET-caching tests are present, though GET-related caching tests could be added if GET endpoints are implemented.
recommendations: Add a dedicated duplicate submission test to verify idempotency or proper error (e.g., 409/422) on repeated externalKey/payload submissions.
Add a test simulating a true 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., database write failure) to complete Server Error Handling coverage.
Introduce rate-limiting tests (e.g., multiple concurrent POSTs in short time) to validate throttling.
Add a test for Forbidden (403) where user lacks specific permissions, in addition to the existing 401 unauthorized test.
If GET endpoints are added, consider including caching behavior tests (ETag, Cache-Control) for read operations; currently POST tests do not validate caching headers.
